transliteration.context: In times of ease and hardship, know your true worth; in joy or sorrow, remember to be humble.

transliteration.couplet:
Em utsav karī dayāḷ, āvyā Mahārāj te Bhenshajāḷ; <RHYME_19>
Rahī rātya padhāriyā Shyām, āvyā Nāgaḍake Loye gām.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: On festive days, we show mercy to Maharaj and Bhenshaj; At night, Shyam wanders alone in the Naga's dark village.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāthī Boṭād āvyā bahunāmī, jamyā sant pote vaḷī Swāmī; <RHYME_20>
Pachhī āvyā Gaḍhaḍe Govind, āpī sahu janne ānand.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The divine soul resides within many, yet only those who have experienced the joy of God's presence can truly understand it. The bliss of knowing God is found in the depths of one's own heart.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyār pachhī thoḍe ghaṇe dan, chālyā Gurjardeshe jīvan; <RHYME_21>
Karī majale majale mukām, chālyā sukhmā sundar Shyām.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: In Gujarat, life's rhythm beats with joy and peace; sweet moments unfold like a beautiful dance of Shyam.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvyā Amadāvād dayāḷ, sange jansamūh marāḷ; <RHYME_22>
Āvyā satsangī sahu samaiye, banī shobhā jāy nahi kaiye.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: A person's kindness and compassion towards others is like a river that flows endlessly, touching the hearts of many. True devotion and beauty can only be found in the company of good people.

transliteration.couplet:
Bahu vidhyanā vājā tyā vāje, āvyā lok darashan kāje; <RHYME_23>
Chāre āshram ne varṇa chār, āvyā darashane nar-nārya.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet in English:

A person's life path is decided by their karma, and they will see the world accordingly; all beings are equally worthy to behold.

transliteration.couplet:
Gāte vāte padhāryā Mahārāj, kaik jannā karavā kāj; <RHYME_24>
Āvī ūtaryā mandir māi, Narnārāyaṇ rāje tyāī.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context:
The Maharaj is wandering in search of someone's work, while the temple of Narayan is situated in his own mind.

He seeks someone else's task, but finds his own inner sanctum.

transliteration.couplet:
Satasangī sānkhya-yogī sant, ūtaryā bhakta ne Bhagwant; <RHYME_25>
Karyā sundar sārā bhojan, jamyā janne bhāve jīvan.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: A saintly yogi and a devoted devotee of God unite to enjoy the sweetest spiritual feast, which is savored in the true taste of life. This union brings joy and fulfillment to their eternal existence.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī poḍhiyā jīvanprāṇ, jāgyā sukhe savāre sujāṇ; <RHYME_26>
Jāgyā Prabhujī prabhāt kāḷe, karyo nityavidhi tyā dayāḷe.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: A life filled with love and joy is like a tree in full bloom. Morning's divine light guides us to follow our daily duties with compassion.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī chotare pāṭ ḍhaḷāvī, teh upar beṭhā chhe āvī; <RHYME_27>
Joyu amṛut draṣhṭie āp, haryā jan taṇā tan tāp.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the passing of time as a fleeting moment, like a small patty of dough (pachhī chotare) that is soon to be forgotten, while above it lies eternity. The speaker laments how precious life is, like a gemstone, and wishes they could freeze time to cherish each moment.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī jan Prabhu pūjā kāj, lāviyā bahu vidhi samāj; <RHYME_28>
Teṇe pūjiyā prāṇ-ādhār, kanṭhe āropyā sundar hār.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The worship of God is done with many formalities and rules, but the true devotee worships with their life breath and adorns the beautiful necklace of devotion on their tongue.

transliteration.couplet:
Gherī sugandhe gulāb fūl, torā gajarā tenā amūlya; <RHYME_29>
Te laī arpyā chhe Harine ange, pachhī pāy lāgyā chhe umange.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: The scent of rose and jasmine fills the air, making even the most valuable things seem ordinary. In God's presence, one forgets worldly concerns and is filled with joy.

transliteration.couplet:
Em liye lāvo vaḷī jan, diye dan sāro darashan; <RHYME_30>
Vaḷī āve chhe purnā jan, karavā kṛupānidhinā darshan.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotee longs to have a glimpse of God's mercy, seeking refuge in His compassion. The merciful Lord grants this glimpse when the devotee approaches Him with a pure heart and humility.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaik āvīne pūchhe chhe prashan, teno uttar āpe jīvan; <RHYME_31>
Suṇī uttar magan thāy, pāmī āshcharya ne gharye jāy.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: The one seeking answers will find solutions in their life; the truth is revealed to those who listen carefully.

transliteration.couplet:
Em līlā kare Alabelo, rang rasiyo chhel chhabīlo; <RHYME_32>
Paherī vastra anūpam angī, shir-pāgh vasantī sorangī.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: A person plays with a child, making them laugh and colorful; their attire is unmatched, like the sweet scents that fill the air.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā darshan diye dayāḷ, nīrkhī magan jan marāl; <RHYME_33>
Em karatā sāt dan gayā, āvyo hutāsanī dan tiyā.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: A glimpse of kindness leads to compassion, and a small act of charity can bring great rewards.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī magāvyā rang sorang, keshu kasumbī rang patang; <RHYME_34>
Lāvyā sakhā āpyo Hari-hāthe, Nāthe ḍhoḷyo sahu sakhā māthe.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the vibrant colors of a peacock's feathers and a kite in flight, with the peahen's beauty attracting Lord Krishna to her side.

transliteration.couplet:
Nākhyo uparye rang gulāl, teṇe sakhā thayā sahu lāl; <RHYME_35>
Jem fūlyu kamaḷ-daḷ vaḷī, tem shobhe chhe sant manḍaḷī.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: A person's beauty is reflected in their words and behavior, making them likable to others; just as a garden blooms with the right care, a peaceful mind can be cultivated through self-reflection.

transliteration.couplet:
Ḍoḍo kamaḷ-madhye dayāḷ, faratī pānkhaḍī shobhe marāḷ; <RHYME_36>
Em khele sakhā sange Nāth, nīrkhī jan thayā chhe sanāth.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: In the midst of worldly desires, compassion shines forth; In the company of true friends, one's soul is at peace.

transliteration.couplet:
Vāje vājintra tyā apār, bole jay sahu nar-nārya; <RHYME_37>
Pachhī nāvāne chāliyā Nāth, sarve sakhājan leī sāth.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a devotee who has surrendered to God's will and is now free from worldly attachments, roaming with the Lord as his companion.

transliteration.couplet:
Nāhī Mahārāj Moṭere gayā, daī darashan tart āviyā; <RHYME_38>
Āvī beṭhā chhe ūche āsan, diye sahu janne darshan.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: The king's messengers arrived, seeking a glimpse of the emperor; they found him reclining comfortably at home, ready to grant an audience.

transliteration.couplet:
Em karatā vītī chhe rātya, sukhe poḍhī jāgyā parabhātya; <RHYME_39>
Karī dātaṇ nāhyā dayāḷ, jamyā jan hete Hari thāḷ.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a person who is awake at night, seeking spiritual growth and enlightenment through self-reflection. They are not attached to worldly desires and instead focus on their devotion to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī jamāḍiyā jan soī, hatī ghebarnī te rasoī; <RHYME_40>
Faryā pangatyamā pānch vār, bahu bahu karī manuvār.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: A person's wealth and happiness increase when they are patient and hardworking. After five years of effort, their circumstances improve greatly.

transliteration.couplet:
Em ānande utsav karī, pachhī tyāthī padhāriyā Hari; <RHYME_41>
Āvyā Ashalāliye Mahārāj, sange harijan munirāj.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: In joyous celebration, I invoke Lord Hari; with devotion, my soul is united to the Lord's sacred presence.

transliteration.couplet:
Karyā sundar sārā bhojan, jamyā Nāth jamāḍiyā jan; <RHYME_42>
Dhanya dhanya bhakta Veṇībhāī, jenī prīt ati Prabhu māī.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context:
A beautiful meal is one that is shared with others, and a devotee's heart is filled with joy when united with the Lord.

The humble devotee Veṇībhāī is blessed to have his love for God overflowing.

transliteration.couplet:
Tenā manorath pūrā karī, pachhī tyā thakī chāliyā Hari; <RHYME_43>
Gām Jetalpurmā jan, bhakta Āsajī ādi pāvan.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: The longing of my soul is now fulfilled and I have found solace in Lord Hari. A devotee from Jetalpur, I am blessed with spiritual enlightenment.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene gher padhāryā Govind, sange sakhā laī janvṛund; <RHYME_44>
Tiyā bhakte karāvyā bhojan, jamyā Nāth sāthe sakhājan.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: God's darlings are nourished by the Lord's presence and company, just like a cow is fed with its calf. In His love, devotees partake in a sacred feast together with Him.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī sāthe laī sarve samāj, āvyā Memdāvād Mahārāj; <RHYME_45>
Rahi rātya āvyā Varatāl, karavā līlā alaukik lāl.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: Memdāvād Mahārāj brings together all social classes like a thread weaving a fabric, transcending the ordinary. His divine play at night is an extraordinary and magical spectacle.

transliteration.couplet:
Hato utsav āḍo pakṣh ek, rākhyā sant karī dayā nek; <RHYME_46>
Nitya diye darashan dān, bahu bhāve karī Bhagwān.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: A festival of charity is celebrated once a year, and kindness is stored for salvation. Every day, one should offer their vision to God with great devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Thāy prashna ne uttar ati, sukh āpe sukhmaya mūrati; <RHYME_47>
Kahe jene maḷyā Bhagwān, tene koī na vyāpe vighan.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: The answer to a difficult question comes unexpectedly, and one's happiness turns into intoxication; just like God, no one can obstruct our path.

transliteration.couplet:
Jem veju vasudhānu kare, tenī choṭ pāchhī nav fare; <RHYME_48>
Tem Prabhune maḷatā jan, rahevu sadāy nihshank man.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: As one tills the earth, they should also take care of their own affairs; and in devotion to God, remain forever free from anxiety.

transliteration.couplet:
Evī vāto kare bahu bahu, suṇī magan thāy jan sahu; <RHYME_49>
Pachhī āvyo utsavano dan, āvyā darashane bahu jan.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a joyful celebration where many people gather to celebrate, and the happiness is shared among everyone. The occasion brings together numerous guests who come to enjoy the festive atmosphere.

transliteration.couplet:
Rāmnavmī ne Ekādashī, karyā utsav hete hulasī; <RHYME_50>
Karyā vipre Vednā uchchār, homyā kunḍe haviṣhyānna sār.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context:
The Navami day of Ramnavmi is celebrated with great joy and fervor; on this day, the sacred rituals are performed with utmost care.

On this Ekadashi day, Vedas are recited with reverence, and offerings to the gods are made with devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Ved vidhiye utsav karī, āpyā dān pachhī harṣh bharī; <RHYME_51>
Ghoḍī palāṇ charma ne asi, āpī pāḍī sahīt mahiṣhī.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the joy and happiness that comes from celebrating festivals (Ved vidhiye) and giving charity (āpyā dān), filling one's heart with delight.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhenu savatsī oḍhāḍī zūlya, āpyā vastra kasumbī amūlya; <RHYME_52>
Sonādoro ne posh rūpaiyā, laī dvij rājī bahu thayā.  <RHYME_52>
transliteration.context: The humble cow gives the most valuable gift, while expensive clothes are of little use to others. Only those with a noble spirit like the sun-god understand this truth.

transliteration.couplet:
Em utsav ānande karī, pachhī tyā thakī padhāryā Hari; <RHYME_53>
Āvyā Pānchāḷ deshmā Nāth, sarve laī nij jan sāth.  <RHYME_53>
transliteration.context: When celebrating the festival with joy and enthusiasm, we remember Lord Krishna's guidance; He is the Lord of all five Pandavas, always accompanied by his own devotees.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvītī Brahmānandne bhāg, teh upādhi karāvī tyāg; <RHYME_54>
Nirbandhanu bandhan kāpī, nij samīpnī sevā āpī.  <RHYME_54>
transliteration.context: A person must let go of worldly attachments and surrender to the divine, freeing themselves from emotional bondages. True happiness is found in selfless service, detached from personal desires.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The festival of Ekadashi in the month of Chaitra brings joy and happiness. It's a celebration that lasts forever, illuminating the beauty of divine play.
